title: Data handling
text: XYData object describes following properties data: x values y values Error y values Dimension x y values Units values stored (e.g., minutes hours dimension Time). object XYData can created scratch using pre-defined x- y- (, optionally, y-error) values. object XYData must label serves name particular data set. Following fields available: Access x, y, y-error values object: Return maximal minimal values x y. y values, error (specified) added (subtracted yMin) /basal values! x y values Dimension Unit. list supported dimensions provided enum Dimension. default, x values dimension Time unit Minute. Setting dimension set unit default unit dimension (even dimension actually change). list default units, please refer OSPS manual. unit y error values automatically set base unit dimension changing dimensions. aware changing unit y values automatically change unit error - possible y values “nmol/l” error “µmol/l”. XYData also inherits several properties class Plotable described section Figure creation.
code: xVals <- c(0, 1, 2, 3) yVals <- c(4, 5, 6, 7) yError <- c(0.1, 0, 0.1, 1)  # Create new object of type XYData xyData <- XYData$new(xVals, yVals, yError = yError, label = "My XY Data") print(xyData) #> XYData:  #>    label: My XY Data  #>    x factor: 1  #>    y factor: 1  #>    x offset: 0  #>    y offset: 0  #>    Color:  #>    Type: p  #>    pch:  #>    lty:  #>    Data type: Unspecified  #>    X dimension: Time  #>    X unit: min  #>    Y dimension: Dimensionless  #>    Y unit:   #>    Y error unit: xyData$xValues #> [1] 0 1 2 3 xyData$yValues #> [1] 4 5 6 7 xyData$yError #> [1] 0.1 0.0 0.1 1.0 xyData$xMax #> [1] 3 xyData$xMin #> [1] 0 xyData$yMax # Maximal value of 7 plus the error 1 #> [1] 8 xyData$yMin # Minimal value of 4 minus the error 0.1 #> [1] 3.9 xyData$xDimension #> [1] "Time" xyData$xUnit #> [1] "min" xyData$yDimension #> [1] "Dimensionless" xyData$yUnit #> [1] "" # List of all supported dimensions length(ospDimensions) #> [1] 90 ospDimensions[[1]] #> [1] "Abundance per mass protein" xyData$yDimension #> [1] "Dimensionless" xyData$yUnit #> [1] "" xyData$yErrorUnit #> [1] "" # Change the dimension of y values xyData$yDimension <- ospDimensions$`Concentration (molar)` xyData$yUnit #> [1] "µmol/l" xyData$yErrorUnit #> [1] "µmol/l"

title: Data handling
text: class XYData inherits properties class Plotable used creating figures XYData (see also Figure creation). Among properties, class Plotable provides properties transformation x- y-values. properties xOffset yOffset added x- y-values, respectively, processing (e.g., creating figure) XYData. properties xFactor yFactor allow scale values multiplying certain factor. Keep mind output XYData$xValues XYData$yValues affected setting offset factor, always possible access untransformed values. contrast, values fields xMax, xMin, yMax, yMin transformed output.
code: xVals <- c(0, 1, 2, 3) yVals <- c(4, 5, 6, 7) yError <- c(0.1, 0, 0.1, 1)  xyData <- XYData$new(xVals, yVals, yError = yError, label = "My XY Data") xyData$xValues #> [1] 0 1 2 3 xyData$yValues #> [1] 4 5 6 7  xyData$xMax #> [1] 3 xyData$xMin #> [1] 0 xyData$yMax # Maximal value of 7 plus the error 1 #> [1] 8 xyData$yMin # Minimal value of 4 minus the error 0.1 #> [1] 3.9  # Offset x values by -1 and y values by 2 xyData$xOffset <- -1 xyData$yOffset <- 2  # xValues and yValues are unaffected xyData$xValues #> [1] 0 1 2 3 xyData$yValues #> [1] 4 5 6 7  xyData$xMax # Maximal value of 3 plus offset -1 #> [1] 2 xyData$xMin # Minimal value of 0 plus offset -1 #> [1] -1 xyData$yMax # Maximal value of 7 plus the error 1 plus offset 2 #> [1] 10 xyData$yMin # Minimal value of 4 minus the error 0.1 plus offset 2 #> [1] 5.9  # Set y factor to 0.5 xyData$yFactor <- 0.5  xyData$yMax # Maximal value of 7 plus the error 1 plus offset 2 multiplied by 0.5 #> [1] 5 xyData$yMin # Minimal value of 4 minus the error 0.1 plus offset 2 multiplied by 0.5 #> [1] 2.95

what: Loading data from excel as XYData
title: Data handling
text: special extension XYData XYData, class designed time-values data used modeling simulation activities OSPS. addition information stored XYData class, following meta data fields available. StudyId PatientId Organ Compartment Species Gender Molecule MW (molecular weight case data describes concentrations amounts chemical molecule) GroupId data set describes amounts concentrations chemical compound, field $MW set molecular weight (g/mol) molecule enable conversion dimensions, often used data plotting. Usually, XYData objects created excel file calling method readOSPSTimeValues. excel file must structure defined Work Instruction “Modeling & Simulation Data Structure”. Additionally, Molecule imported, sheet “VIVO/VITRO COMPOUND PROPERTIES” file (see Work Instruction) must present retrieve molecular weight imported molecule. method readOSPSTimeValues reads contents excel file generates list XYData objects according groupings data. data generally grouped sheets excel file specified columns. read data using readOSPSTimeValues, object class DataConfiguration must created passed method. DataConfiguration structure containing following information: dataFolder: Path folder excel files located dataFile: Name excel file time-values data. Must located dataFolder. compoundPropertiesFile: Name excel file compound properties. Must located dataFolder. dataSheets: Name data sheet(s) time-values data within excel file. Multiple sheets can processed. columnsToSplitBy: list containing names columns data split separate data sets. XValuesColumn: Index column contains x values. YValuesColumn: Index column contains y values. YErrorColumn: Index column contains error values y values. values columnsToSplitBy, XValuesColumn, YValuesColumn, YErrorColumn set default values can changed user. Reading file produces two data sets, two different values IndividualId contained data sheet. method automatically recognizes sets dimensions units y y values. Note dataType field automatically set “Observed”.
code: dataConf <- DataConfiguration$new(   dataFolder = file.path(getwd(), "..", "tests", "data"),   dataFile = "CompiledDataSet.xlsx",   compoundPropertiesFile = "Compound_Properties.xlsx",   dataSheets = c("TestSheet_1") ) print(dataConf) #> DataConfiguration:  #>    Data file directory: C:/Users/IndrajeetPatil/Documents/GitHub/esqlabsR/vignettes/../tests/data  #>    Data file: CompiledDataSet.xlsx  #>    Sheets: TestSheet_1  #>    CompoundProperties file: Compound_Properties.xlsx  #>    Columns to split by: Group.Id Gender Patient.Id Dose Route Molecule Organ Compartment  #>    X values column: 10  #>    Y values column: 11  #>    Y error column: 12  dataConf$columnsToSplitBy #> [1] "Group.Id"    "Gender"      "Patient.Id"  "Dose"        "Route"       #> [6] "Molecule"    "Organ"       "Compartment" observedData <- readOSPSTimeValues(dataConfiguration = dataConf) #> Warning in stringToNum(yVals): NAs introduced by coercion names(observedData) #> [1] "TestSheet_1"  observedData[[1]] #> $Male #> $Male$Ind1 #> $Male$Ind1$iv #> $Male$Ind1$iv$Dapagliflozin #> $Male$Ind1$iv$Dapagliflozin$PeripheralVenousBlood #> $Male$Ind1$iv$Dapagliflozin$PeripheralVenousBlood$Plasma #> XYData:  #>    label: TestSheet_1.Male.Ind1.iv.Dapagliflozin.PeripheralVenousBlood.Plasma  #>    x factor: 1  #>    y factor: 1  #>    x offset: 0  #>    y offset: 0  #>    Color:  #>    Type: p  #>    pch:  #>    lty:  #>    Data type: Unspecified  #>    X dimension: Time  #>    X unit: h  #>    Y dimension: Concentration (mass)  #>    Y unit: ng/ml  #>    Y error unit: ng/ml  #>  #>  #>  #>  #>  #>  #> $Female #> $Female$Ind2 #> $Female$Ind2$iv #> $Female$Ind2$iv$Dapagliflozin #> $Female$Ind2$iv$Dapagliflozin$PeripheralVenousBlood #> $Female$Ind2$iv$Dapagliflozin$PeripheralVenousBlood$Plasma #> XYData:  #>    label: TestSheet_1.Female.Ind2.iv.Dapagliflozin.PeripheralVenousBlood.Plasma  #>    x factor: 1  #>    y factor: 1  #> title: Introduction to esqlabsR
text: package builds functionality ospsuite package. strongly recommended get familiar R-Introduction section OSPS manual. order load simulation R, must present *.pkml file format. Every simulation PK-Sim MoBi can exported *.pkml file. examples shown documentation based Aciclovir example model, stated otherwise. model can found PK-Sim examples folder OSPS installation. Alternatively, can also download . documentation divided three parts covering following aspects: Facilitating M&S Data handling Figure creation Helper methods

title: Introduction to esqlabsR
text: esqlabsR package utilizes concept object-oriented (OO) programming based R6 system. philosophy package offer functional programming workflow common R users, important understand basic concepts OO programming. Many functions implemented esqlabsR return instance (object) class. objects can used inputs methods. Additionally, object offers set properties (can objects) methods, accessible $ sign: Important information object can printed calling print(object). important classes : DataMapping Organizes objects type XYData, describing groupings used creating figures. See Creating figures information. Plotable XYData, inherits Plotable Organizes kind x-y-values data. See Data handling information. DataConfiguration Structure containing information observed data import. See Data handling information.

what:
Check if two parameters are equal is respect to certain properties. The parameters are not equal if:
The paths of the parameters are not equal;
The types of the formulas differ (types checked: isConstant, isDistributed, isExplicit, isTable);
Constant formulas have different values;
Distributed formulas have different values (not checking for distribution)
Explicit formulas: If formula string are not equal, OR one of the parameter values is fixed (formula is overridden),
OR both parameter values are fixed and differ,
OR checkFormulaValues is TRUE and the values differ (disregarding of overridden or not)
Table formulas: If the number of points differ, OR any of the points differ,
OR one of the parameter values is fixed (formula is overridden),
OR both parameter values are fixed and differ
#' — isParametersEqual

Check if two parameters are equal is respect to certain properties. The parameters are not equal if:
The paths of the parameters are not equal;
The types of the formulas differ (types checked: isConstant, isDistributed, isExplicit, isTable);
Constant formulas have different values;
Distributed formulas have different values (not checking for distribution)
Explicit formulas: If formula string are not equal, OR one of the parameter values is fixed (formula is overridden),
OR both parameter values are fixed and differ,
OR checkFormulaValues is TRUE and the values differ (disregarding of overridden or not)
Table formulas: If the number of points differ, OR any of the points differ,
OR one of the parameter values is fixed (formula is overridden),
OR both parameter values are fixed and differ
#' — isParametersEqual

Check if two parameters are equal is respect to certain properties. The parameters are not equal if:
The paths of the parameters are not equal;
The types of the formulas differ (types checked: isConstant, isDistributed, isExplicit, isTable);
Constant formulas have different values;
Distributed formulas have different values (not checking for distribution)
Explicit formulas: If formula string are not equal, OR one of the parameter values is fixed (formula is overridden),
OR both parameter values are fixed and differ,
OR checkFormulaValues is TRUE and the values differ (disregarding of overridden or not)
Table formulas: If the number of points differ, OR any of the points differ,
OR one of the parameter values is fixed (formula is overridden),
OR both parameter values are fixed and differ
#' — isParametersEqual
text: parameter1 First parameter compare parameter2 Second parameter compare checkFormulaValues TRUE, values explicit formulas always compared. Otherwise, values compared formulas overridden (isFixedValue == TRUE). FALSE default.
